oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Union bass drum
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Union bass drum with two drum sticks, one spur, a Civil War medal, and drum strap. It was used in Masonic parades after the war in Indiana. Written around the drum head are the names of the battles Shiloh, Chickamauga, and Stones River.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Fort Negley, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
